text:
From latest svn, on line 194 there appears to be a loop that doesn't do what one
would think. This should keep appending the first result onto the StringBuffer
name, if the user has multiple names instead of cycling through them, or only
grabbing the first one. I'm not sure what the design intent was, but this is
probably not doing it.

for (NamingEnumeration enumeration = userNames.getAll(); enumeration.hasMore();
enumeration.next())
                            name.append((String)userNames.get());

text:
I'm running my own version of the code since I need to authenticate against
kerberos. I've stripped the loop out. I don't know that having multiple sn
fields in ldap is all that common. And how it would be appending the names if
the code actually worked wouldn't make sense. Looking through the history, I
don't see when this code was added. Since no one is complaining about the
current behavior, I say strip the loop out.
